p: The medium suitable region was located around the edges of the highly suitable region as follows: Southwest Heilongjiang, most of Jilin, Central and West Liaoning, Northwest and Southeast Hebei, West and East Shandong, East Henan, West Hubei, South Shaanxi, Central Gansu, the east corner of Qinghai, most of Ningxia, Central and West Inner Mongolia, the northeast corner of Yunnan, North Guizhou, Central Hunan, West and Southeast Jiangxi, West Zhejiang, South Anhui, and other scattered regions. The total area of this region was approximately 1.21 × 10 6 km 2, which accounts for 12.62% of the total land in China. The low suitable region had the widest distribution, which included Xinjiang, Qinghai, Xizang, West Gansu, most of Sichuan, most of Yunnan, Guangxi, Guangdong, Hainan, Taiwan, West and North Inner Mongolia, and North Heilongjiang. The total area of this region was approximately 7.71 × 10 6 km 2, which accounts for approximately 80.31% of the total land in China.
